title: GREY POUPON Saucy Fish
summary: GREY POUPON Saucy Fish is a gluten free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian recipe with 30 servings. For 29 cents per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 28 calories, 3g of protein, and 2g of fat. 1 person found this recipe to be scrumptious and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 30 minutes. A mixture of grey poupon dijon mustard, horseradish sauce, tilapia fillets, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. With a spoonacular score of 12%, this dish is not so outstanding. Try GREY POUPON Creamed Spinach, GREY POUPON-Maple Salmon, and Quiche Lorraine Grey Poupon for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Maysaran Arsheen Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Maysara Arsheen Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A bright expression of fruit right up front, greeting your palate with notes of cut grass on a warm day. The wine is anchored by crisp acidity, but not so much as to overpower a fleeting tease of sweetness that leaves you smiling. Arsheen has a smart, refreshing character that will bestow clarity to a range of preparations of fish, fowl, and pork.

instructions: Heat oven to 350F.                                            Mix all ingredients except fish until blended.                                            Place fish in 13x9-inch pan sprayed with cooking spray; spread with mayo mixture.                                            Bake 15 to 20 min. or until fish flakes easily with fork.

steps.step: Mix all ingredients except fish until blended.
Place fish in 13x9-inch pan sprayed with cooking spray; spread with mayo mixture.
Bake 15 to 20 min. or until fish flakes easily with fork.
